item.title: Secret Service Director Heads to Congress
item.description: Kimberly Cheatle’s appearance before the House Oversight Committee comes after a firestorm last week in which lawmakers expressed disbelief and anger over the near assassination of former President Donald Trump.

item.title: How Kamala Harris Views Policy
item.description: If she leads the Democratic ticket, the vice president would be unlikely to dramatically shift off the trajectory of President Biden’s agenda.

item.title: Both Sides Abruptly Shift Campaign Strategies After Biden's Withdrawal
item.description: Trump allies are already pouring millions into anti-Harris ads, while Democrats hope a new ticket will add a better and younger contrast with the GOP nominee.

item.title: Ryanair Warns of Slump in Air Fares
item.description: Ryanair said it expected its air fares this summer will be “materially lower” than last year, in an announcement that caused its share price to plummet on fears the post-covid boom in the airline industry is over.

item.title: Gold Rises on Safe-Haven Appetite After Biden Drops out of U.S. Election
item.description: Gold prices crept higher on safe-haven demand and a weaker dollar as investors weighed Joe Biden’s decision to end his reelection bid.

item.title: Oil Inches Higher on Softer U.S. Dollar After Biden Drops Out
item.description: Oil prices edged higher on a softer dollar, supported by prospects the Fed will soon start cutting rates and after China’s unexpected decision to cut key rates in efforts to boost growth.

item.title: Vodafone Offloads Further Stake in Vantage Towers
item.description: Vodafone has sold a further 10% stake in Oak Holdings, the partnership that co-controls Vantage Towers, for $1.4 billion.

item.title: Trump Trade Tariffs Tarnish Outlook for Chinese Equities
item.description: Chinese equities could be among the biggest losers in the event of a potential Trump election victory, according to Citi Wealth, on concerns about his trade policies.

item.title: Vivendi Chooses London and Amsterdam for Possible Unit Listings
item.description: Vivendi said it would list its Canal+ TV business in London and its Havas advertising unit in Amsterdam if a proposed break-up plan goes ahead.

item.title: Galp Upgrades Guidance After Profit Beat
item.description: Galp slightly lifted its full-year financial outlook after second-quarter earnings topped forecasts, driven by its upstream unit.

item.title: Dollar Edges Lower After Biden Withdraws From Presidential Race
item.description: The dollar’s reaction to Biden’s withdrawal has been subdued so far as such an announcement wasn’t ruled out and because investors will probably want to see what impact the decision will have in fresh polls, Unicredit Research said.

item.title: Eurozone Bond Markets Await Data For Guidance This Week
item.description: Eurozone fixed income markets will focus on business sentiment data this week, and await input from U.S. indicators on Friday, Commerzbank Research said.

item.title: A Stock-Market Rotation of Historic Proportions Is Taking Shape
item.description: The stock market has suddenly turned upside down. Few investors saw the shift coming, and many are puzzled by what is behind it.

item.title: 'A Rubik's Cube in the Sky': Israel Struggles to Defend Against Drones
item.description: An attack on Tel Aviv attributed to Yemen’s Houthis has exposed a hole in Israel’s high-tech air defenses.

item.title: Died: Sheila Jackson Lee, 74, House member from Texas.
item.description: Died: Sheila Jackson Lee, 74, House member from Texas.

item.title: Travelers confronted a third day of flight snarls and long waits at U.S. airports, as many computer monitors still displayed the telltale blue screens of the technology meltdown.
item.description: Travelers confronted a third day of flight snarls and long waits at U.S. airports, as many computer monitors still displayed the telltale blue screens of the technology meltdown.

item.title: Videogame maker Electronic Arts relied on artificial intelligence to create images of many of the 11,000 players seen in its newest Madden college-football game.
item.description: Videogame maker Electronic Arts relied on artificial intelligence to create images of many of the 11,000 players seen in its newest Madden college-football game.

item.title: Israel for the first time staged a direct airstrike against Houthi rebels in Yemen, a day after the Iran-backed militants hit Tel Aviv with a drone attack.
item.description: Israel for the first time staged a direct airstrike against Houthi rebels in Yemen, a day after the Iran-backed militants hit Tel Aviv with a drone attack.

item.title: The stock market has turned upside down, with the 'Magnificent Seven' tech companies stumbling and the Russell 2000 index of smaller stocks beating the S&P 500 by a historic margin.
item.description: The stock market has turned upside down, with the ‘Magnificent Seven’ tech companies stumbling and the Russell 2000 index of smaller stocks beating the S&P 500 by a historic margin.

item.title: At least 20 U.S. citizens are in Russian jails, six of them since Journal reporter U.S. or dual U.S.-Russian citizens Evan Gershkovich was arrested in March 2023, in an apparent strategy to put leverage on the U.S.
item.description: At least 20 U.S. citizens are in Russian jails, six of them since Journal reporter U.S. or dual U.S.-Russian citizens Evan Gershkovich was arrested in March 2023, in an apparent strategy to put leverage on the U.S.
